NI Web Server Privileges Page (Web Service Properties Dialog Box)

Requires: Full Development System (Windows 64-bit)

From the Project Explorer window, right-click a Web service project item and select Properties to display the Web Service Properties dialog box. Click NI Web Server Privileges in the Category list to display this page.

Use this page to create and define privileges for the Web service. You can associate each privilege with different roles.

This page includes the following components:

  • Privilege—Displays the names of privileges you create for the Web service. The privilege name is required and cannot contain any empty spaces or colons.
  • Description—Provides a short description for each privilege. The descriptions for user-defined privileges also appear on the Applications tab in NI Web Server Configuration.
  • Role—Configures which roles can perform different actions. You can associate each privilege with pre-defined roles, such as administrators, users, and everyone, or any custom roles that you added on the Roles tab in NI Web Server Configuration.
    Note  After publishing and installing the Web service, you can change the role associated with the Web service privilege in NI Web Server Configuration.
